Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully Funded Scholarships by the Thai Government, covering all expenses for the duration of the study.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition fees
*   Monthly stipend (approximately 16,000 Baht to support living and housing expenses)
*   Airfare (return flights in economy class, with reimbursement amount varying based on the applicant’s home location)
*   Meals
*   Accommodation
*   Allowance
*   Books
*   Transport
*   Thesis support
*   Health coverage
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to all international students from ASEAN or Non-ASEAN countries, and candidates from all around the world (excluding Thai nationals). Students who have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester are not eligible to apply. Applicants must be in good physical health. Scholarship recipients are not allowed to accept any off-campus employment in Thailand during the term of the scholarship. Applicants must be 40 years or younger.
Language_Certificate: English proficiency certificate from prior university, TOEFL (min 500), IELTS (min 5.0)
Career_Plan: Study plan or description of academic interests (on a separate A4-sized paper)
Other_Requirements: Two recommendation letters are required, to be provided by the Head, the Director, or the Dean of the applicant's previous institution. No application fee.
Scholarship_Info: The Chulalongkorn University Graduate Scholarship Program for ASEAN or Non-ASEAN Countries offers fully funded opportunities for international students to pursue Master's and PhD degrees at Chulalongkorn University in Thailand. Established by Chulalongkorn University to provide financial assistance to international students pursuing higher graduate studies, thereby fostering academic cooperation between Thailand and foreign countries. It covers a comprehensive range of expenses, targeting excellent international students from around the world (excluding Thai nationals).
Application_Documents:
Completed application form for the Graduate Scholarship Program for ASEAN or Non-ASEAN Countries.
Curriculum Vitae (CV).
Copy of Certificate of Graduation and an official transcript of academic records.
English proficiency score record (TOEFL, IELTS, or university certificate).
Copy of passport.
Study plan / description of academic interests (on a separate A4-sized paper).
One 1-inch-colored photo (with blue background), taken no more than six months prior, in polite attire, signed on the reverse side (one copy to be attached to the application form).
Two recommendation letters from the Head, the Director, or the Dean.

Scholarship_Name: Danish Government Scholarship (University of Southern Denmark)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
This is a fully funded scholarship, granted either as a full or partial tuition fee waiver.
*   Full Tuition Fee Waiver: Covers the entire tuition cost for the Master's program.
*   Partial Tuition Fee Waiver: Covers tuition fees for one year (typically the second and fourth semesters), requiring the student to pay for the first and third semesters.
Covered Expenses:
*   Full tuition fees for the Master's program.
*   Monthly stipend to support living expenses.
*   A grant to help with living costs.
Nature of Support: The scholarship provides comprehensive financial support, enabling students to focus on their studies without significant financial burden.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students from non-EU/EEA countries (including Switzerland) who are eligible to pay tuition fees in Denmark. Applicants must be highly qualified and accepted into a full-time Master's program at the University of Southern Denmark. For exchange or guest students, eligibility for master-level courses requires completion of courses comparable to 180 ECTS credits (three years of studies) at the university level. Applicants receiving the Danish State Grant are not eligible for this scholarship. A strong desire to study in Denmark is also considered.
Language_Certificate: IELTS: A minimum score of 6.5. TOEFL: A minimum score of 575 (paper-based), 230 (computer-based), or 88 (internet-based).
Other_Requirements: Applicants must complete and submit the online admission application for their chosen Master’s program at SDU. Incomplete or late applications will not be eligible for the scholarship. All necessary supporting documents must be submitted with the application. For eligible MSc in Engineering programs, students are automatically considered for the scholarship upon applying for the program, meaning a separate scholarship application may not be needed in these specific cases. However, some sources indicate a 'completed scholarship application form (via the university’s portal)' is generally required.
Scholarship_Info: The Danish Government Scholarship at the University of Southern Denmark (SDU) offers a significant opportunity for highly qualified international students from non-EU/EEA countries to pursue Master's degree programs in Denmark. Fully funded by the Danish Government through the Ministry of Higher Education and Science, this scholarship covers full tuition fees and provides a monthly stipend or a grant for living expenses. It aims to acknowledge the valuable contributions of international students and facilitate their postgraduate education at SDU, a university recognized among the top 50 globally by the QS World Ranking. The scholarship is primarily targeted at specific engineering Master's programs offered at SDU's Vejle or Sønderborg campuses. The scholarship is a prestigious award designed to support non-EU/EEA students pursuing Master's degrees at SDU. It underscores Denmark's commitment to attracting global talent and fostering a diverse academic environment. SDU is recognized as one of the world's top 50 universities, offering a dynamic academic setting.
Application_Documents: All necessary supporting documents must be submitted with the application.
Timeline: Currently open : Applications for 2026-2027 academic year, 2025-10-15 : February Intake Application Deadline, 2026-01-08 : General Application Deadline, 2026-02-01 : MSc Program Specific Application Deadline, 2026-03-01 : September Intake Application Deadline, September 2026 : Autumn Semester Start

Funding_Details:
- An economy class air-ticket to Brunei Darussalam from the scholarship recipient’s country of origin or country of domicile prior to the commencement of the course.
- An economy class air-ticket from Brunei Darussalam to the scholarship recipient’s country of origin or country of domicile upon completion of the course.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students and foreign students from various countries. Specific calls may target citizens of OIC Member States. The BDGS (IS) designation specifically caters to international students.
Eligible_Fields: Arts, Islamic Studies, Business Administration, Business Management, Humanities
Eligible_Field_Group: ARTS & DESIGN, STEM - NATURAL SCIENCES, STEM - ENGINEERING, SOCIAL SCIENCES & HUMANITIES, BUSINESS & ECONOMICS
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: Undergraduate Degree: Five (5) Distinctions (As & Bs) in the Senior Secondary Certificate Examination or equivalent. Postgraduate Master’s Degree: Minimum qualification set by the respective university for admission to graduate studies, typically a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.
Language_Certificate: Credit 6 at GCE 'O' Level Examination, OR Grade 'C' in IGCSE English (as a second language), OR IELTS score of 6.0
Special_Circumstances: Citizens of OIC Member States for certain calls.
Career_Plan: Applicants must submit an essay of up to 200 words describing their plan of study and/or research and relating it to their future career aspirations.
Other_Requirements: Reference letters are required. Upon completion of the program, the scholarship recipient will be required to leave Brunei Darussalam with immediate effect. A scholarship recipient is not permitted to undertake any paid employment or to serve on the staff of any country’s representative mission in Brunei Darussalam during the duration of the scholarship. Recipients must conform to all the rules and regulations underlying this scholarship award scheme.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship (BDGS) for Foreign Students is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program offered by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. It provides a unique opportunity for international students to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate, and Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs at leading higher education institutions within Brunei Darussalam. It is an annual award scheme that aims to attract talented international students to Brunei Darussalam, fostering academic excellence and cultural exchange.
Application_Documents:
- Completing the online BDGS Application Form.
- Applicants applying to Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must also complete a separate online application through UBD's admission portal.
- Completed application forms, along with supporting documents, are usually submitted via email to a specified address (updated for each academic session).
Timeline:
2025/2026 academic session : Applications currently closed
February 2025 : Applications were open (estimated for 2025/2026 session)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Covered Expenses Include:
*   Monthly Stipend: Up to 9000 TL per month, varying by study level.
*   Tuition Fee: Full coverage of university tuition fees.
*   Return Flight Ticket: A one-time return flight ticket to Turkey at the beginning of the study and back to the home country upon graduation.
*   Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance coverage.
*   Accommodation: Provision of accommodation for scholarship recipients.
*   Turkish Language Course: All awardees without a C1 Level Turkish Proficiency Certificate must attend a 1-year Turkish Language Course and attain C1 level by the end of the academic year, even if placed in English or other language medium programs.
Eligibility_Criteria: General eligibility criteria apply to all applicants, though specific requirements may vary depending on the level of study (associate, undergraduate, master's, PhD) and the specific scholarship category. Applicants must fulfill specific requirements, including academic qualifications, age limits, and language proficiency. Eligible groups include international students from all nationalities and individuals currently enrolled in programs in Turkish universities at the level of education they will apply for.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: Not broadly specified; some specialized programs may require 5+ years
Language_Certificate: Internationally accepted language proficiency certificate (e.g., TOEFL, DELF) for non-Turkish medium programs; C1 Level Turkish Proficiency Certificate required for all awardees by end of 1-year Turkish Language Course.
Age: Undergraduate: Under 21; Master's: Under 30; PhD: Under 35; Research Scholarship: Under 50
Special_Circumstances: Applicants currently enrolled in programs in Turkish universities at the level of education they will apply for are eligible. Undergraduate scholarships are regionally defined and often focused on developing countries and regions with historical links with Turkey.
Career_Plan: A crucial component outlining motivations, academic goals, and what the applicant hopes to achieve. It should be tailored to emphasize how the applicant meets specific criteria.
Other_Requirements: Reference letters (academic or professional); International exam results (e.g., GRE, GMAT, SAT) if specified by the chosen university or program; Specific nationality criteria.
Scholarship_Info: The Türkiye Scholarships, officially known as Türkiye Bursları, is a prestigious international scholarship program fully funded by the Government of Turkey. It is the largest Turkish scholarship program designed for international students, aiming to strengthen educational and cultural ties between Turkey and other countries. The program offers quality education at renowned Turkish universities across various study levels, attracting a significant number of applicants globally.
Application_Documents:
Required Documents:
*   Academic achievements (GPA, coursework, academic honors/awards).
*   Language proficiency certificates (e.g., TOEFL, DELF, if applicable).
*   International exam results (e.g., GRE, GMAT, SAT, if required by the university/program).
*   A personal statement.
*   Recommendation letters.
*   Other documents as specified by the scholarship provider.
Timeline:
Annually January 10 - February 20 : Main Application Period
Four times a year : Research Scholarship Applications

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Stipend, Other Costs, Partial Funding
Funding_Details:
The scholarship provides comprehensive coverage, including tuition waiver, accommodation, a monthly stipend, and comprehensive medical insurance. While the scholarship is generally full, some programs may offer partial funding. The scholarship amount, approximately 10,000 USD, is disbursed directly to the designated Chinese universities, not to individual students.
* Tuition waiver
* Accommodation (on-campus or off-campus allowance)
* Stipend (living allowance)
* Comprehensive medical insurance
Eligibility_Criteria: The CGS is open to outstanding international students, teachers, and scholars who are non-Chinese citizens and are in good health. Applicants must be citizens of a country other than the People's Republic of China. Dual nationality holders are generally not eligible to apply. Applicants must be in good physical and mental health. Eligibility is open to: Undergraduate students, Master's students, Doctoral students, General scholars (for non-degree study or research), Senior scholars (for advanced research). Applicants must not have completed their previous study in China within the last year. Program-Specific Requirements: 'Silk Road' Program requires applicants to be nationals of countries belonging to the 'One Belt One Road' initiative. AASCU Program supports students enrolled at AASCU member institutions. CSC Type C Scholarship is reserved for students who are already studying at a university in China. Applicants must consciously abide by Chinese laws and regulations.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: At least 3 years for certain graduate/senior scholar programs
Language_Certificate: Chinese-Taught Bachelor's: HSK 3 (180); Chinese-Taught Master's/PhD: HSK 4 (180); English-Taught/Chinese Language Study: Not required
Age: Undergraduate: Under 25; Master's/General Scholar: Under 35; Doctoral/HSK Winner: Under 40
Special_Circumstances: Silk Road Program: Nationals from 'One Belt One Road' initiative countries; Great Wall Program: Students/scholars from developing countries via UNESCO; AASCU Program: Students at AASCU member institutions; CSC Type C Scholarship: Students already studying in China
Other_Requirements: Applicants must not have completed their previous study in China within the last year; Applicants must consciously abide by Chinese laws and regulations; If a study plan extends beyond the academic year for which the scholarship is granted, students may need to secure additional funding from their host university to cover the exceeded period.
Scholarship_Info: The Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS) is a prestigious and comprehensive scholarship program established by the Chinese government to foster mutual understanding, cooperation, and exchanges in various fields between China and other countries. Administered primarily by the China Scholarship Council (CSC) under the Chinese Ministry of Education, it sponsors outstanding international students, teachers, and scholars from around the world to pursue studies and conduct research in China.
Application_Documents:
Completed Application Form for Chinese Government Scholarship (online).
Valid ordinary passport.
Valid HSK score report (if applicable, meeting minimum requirements).
Two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English from professors or associate professors (required for graduate programs or senior scholar programs).
Study Plan or Research Proposal in English or Chinese: Undergraduate: Minimum 200 words. Master's/PhD: Minimum 800 words.
Academic transcripts.
Highest degree certificate (notarized copies).
Foreigner Physical Examination Form.
Admission Notice (if already obtained from a Chinese university).
Visa Application for Study In China (JW201) (issued after scholarship confirmation).
Timeline:

2026-02-08 : General Application Deadline for AY 2026/2027
2025-02-15 : Shanghai University Deadline for AY 2025 (Note: University-specific deadlines vary)
Following application period : Award Notification

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Stipendium Hungaricum program provides comprehensive financial support, ensuring a tuition-free education for its recipients. The covered expenses include:
*   Tuition-free education: Full waiver of tuition fees.
*   Monthly stipend:
    *   For doctoral level, the monthly stipend is HUF 140,000 (approximately EUR 365-390) for the first phase (4 semesters) and HUF 180,000 (approximately EUR 470-500) for the second phase (4 semesters). This stipend is provided for 12 months a year until the completion of studies. Stipend amounts for other study levels vary by program.
*   Accommodation contribution: Scholarship holders receive a free dormitory place or a contribution of HUF 40,000 per month towards accommodation costs for the entire duration of the scholarship period.
*   Medical insurance: Comprehensive medical insurance is provided.
Quantity: Currently over 12,000 students; More than 4,100 scholarships awarded in 2019-2020 academic year.
Eligibility_Criteria: The Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship is open to foreign students and high-achieving international students with an excellent academic track record. Eligibility is primarily based on bilateral educational cooperation agreements between Hungary and the governments of the sending partners. Applicants can only apply for scholarship types and study fields determined in these specific cooperation programs. Candidates must be 18 years old before August 30th of the application year. Self-financed students currently studying in a Hungarian Higher Education Institution are only eligible to apply for the same study level under specific, program-defined conditions. The program also includes a dedicated 'Students at Risk Subprogramme'.
Eligible_Fields: Media Studies, Economics, Computer Science, Public Administration
Eligible_Field_Group: SOCIAL SCIENCES & HUMANITIES, BUSINESS & ECONOMICS, STEM - COMPUTER SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY, LAW, POLITICS & GOVERNANCE, HEALTH & MEDICINE
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Language_Certificate: Official test results or certificates are required (e.g., TOEFL IBT, TOEFL ITP, IELTS, or Cambridge Certificate), with program-specific proficiency levels. Proof that previous studies were conducted in the language of the selected program can also be accepted.
Age: Minimum 18 years old by August 30th of application year
Career_Plan: Some sending partners mandate a commitment from scholarship holders to return and work in their home country for a specified period after completing their studies (e.g., Kazakhstan: one year, Pakistan: a period prescribed by HEC). Pakistani nationals must submit a legal bond to this effect.
Other_Requirements: Pakistani nationals are required not to change their discipline after the final award of the scholarship and must submit a bond to this effect. Doctoral Full Degree (Brazil specific) applicants are required to demonstrate scientific or technological research production (e.g., published articles, book chapters, book authorship, publications in event annals) and/or coordination of research or extension projects. Doctoral programs may require a 'Statement of the Supervisor' (an acceptance statement from a potential supervisor) to be attached to the application by a specified deadline. Current Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship holders must earn at least eighteen credits (total 36 credits) on average over the last two semesters in which their student status was not suspended. Scholarship holders are required to provide consent to data processing and have an obligation to inform the authorities about any criminal proceedings initiated against them during the scholarship period. Some programs, particularly in medical fields, may require an entrance examination consisting of written and oral parts in Biology, Chemistry, and English Language. For partial (exchange) study programs, a certificate about student status issued by the current higher education institution is required, certifying that student status is expected to exist during the partial studies. All original documents not in the language of the selected study program or Hungarian must be accompanied by official translations. For some sending partners (e.g., Pakistan), it is mandatory to submit online applications on both the Hungarian scholarship website and the respective national scholarship portal (e.g., HEC website for Pakistan). While studying under the Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship, students are generally allowed to work part-time, though they must take into consideration and comply with Hungarian tax regulations.
Scholarship_Info: The Stipendium Hungaricum is the official Hungarian Government Scholarship, a prestigious program designed to attract top international students to Hungary. The scholarship program is managed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade and co-ordinated by the Tempus Public Foundation. It offers opportunities for study across various levels of higher education in Hungary. Launched by the Hungarian Government in 2013, the Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship program aims to promote the internationalisation of Hungarian higher education, strengthen international academic relations, and enhance Hungary's reputation as a hub for quality education. It seeks to attract high-achieving international students who can establish personal and professional links to Hungary.
Application_Documents:
*   Completed online application form.
*   Application Guide and Call for Applications (for reference).
*   Secondary school graduation certificate or equivalent (for Bachelor's/One-tier Master's).
*   Bachelor’s degree certificate or equivalent (for Master's).
*   Master’s diploma (optional, for PhD).
*   Proficiency test results (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS, Cambridge Certificate).
*   Updated curriculum vitae (required for Brazil PhD, extracted from Lattes Platform).
*   Statement of the Supervisor (for doctoral programs, if required).
*   Certificate about student status (for partial studies).
*   Translations of all documents not in the language of the selected study program or Hungarian.

2026-02-28 : Application Deadline (expected for 2026/2027 academic year)
2025-08-01 : Final degree and transcript documents submission for selected candidates (e.g., for 2025/2026 academic year)

Funding_Details:

    PhD Degree: CNY 2000
Insurance: Comprehensive insurance coverage valued at CNY 800 per year.
The scholarship provides full financial support, with specific funding levels potentially varying based on a "prize type" (first prize or second prize), though detailed differences for these prize types are not specified beyond the general stipends.
Covered Expenses:
    Tuition fees

Eligibility_Criteria:
Applicants must be international students (foreign self-funded).
Open to prospective or current undergraduate, postgraduate (Master's), or PhD students.
Applicants must be normally enrolled in or wish to study at a higher education institution in Tianjin.
Applicants must meet the language requirements of their chosen higher education institution.
The scholarship is available for students pursuing Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD degrees.

Language_Certificate:

For English-instructed programs: English Proficiency Certificates (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, or other recognized certificates).

Scholarship_Info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship is a prestigious one-year award provided by the Tianjin Government in China, offering full financial support to attract and support international students (both prospective and current) pursuing higher education in various academic programs at Tianjin universities. It is renewable annually based on academic performance and compliance with university policies.

Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form (to be filled in Chinese or English by typing, with a recent photo pasted).
HSK-5 certificate (for Chinese-instructed programs).
English Proficiency Certificates (for English-instructed programs).
Personal Statement (including study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, personal strengths; minimum word counts apply based on degree level).
Application Form for Foreigners Wishing to Study at Tianjin University (specifically for Tianjin University applicants).
Other Chinese learning and examination certificates (if applicable).

Scholarship_Name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship
Funding_Details:
Key Benefits:
*   Stipend: A €10,000 stipend is provided for one year of full-time study.
*   Tuition Fees: A full tuition fee waiver is granted by the host Irish higher education institution.

Expenses Not Covered:
*   Visa & Immigration Costs
*   Travel Costs
*   Medical Insurance
*   Living Expenses beyond the €10,000 stipend
Eligibility_Criteria:
Nationality and Domicile:
*   Applicants must be citizens of countries other than the EU/EEA/Switzerland/United Kingdom.
*   Applicants must have a domiciliary of origin outside the EU/EEA/Switzerland/United Kingdom.

Academic Program and Admission:
*   Applicants must have a conditional or final offer of admission to a full-time postgraduate programme at an eligible Irish higher education institution at the time of applying for the scholarship.
*   Eligible programmes include Master’s, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD degrees at NFQ levels 9 or 10.
*   The offer letter must explicitly state that the applicant is an international fee-paying student who will be studying on a full-time basis in a postgraduate programme for at least one year.

Previous Scholarship Holdings:
*   Applicants must not have previously held a GOI-IES scholarship.
*   For research master’s scholarships, applicants must not currently hold, or have previously held, a Council Postgraduate Scholarship.
*   For PhD degree scholarships, applicants must not currently hold or have previously held any Council Postgraduate Scholarship other than those which would enable them to obtain a research master’s degree.
Min_Gpa: minimum of a 2.1 honors undergraduate degree (or equivalent)
Language_Certificate: IELTS: Minimum score of 5 (no band lower than 6.0). TOEFL: Minimum score of 90.
Other_Requirements:
Reference Letters:
*   References are a crucial component of the application. They should be between 500 and 1,000 words and must clearly demonstrate how the applicant matches the candidate profile outlined in the scholarship call document. Candidates are responsible for uploading the references provided to them by their referees, as the application portal does not allow referees to upload them directly.

Candidate Profile:
*   Beyond academic qualifications, applicants should demonstrate: Academic excellence, Leadership potential, A commitment to global engagement, The potential to be future leaders in their field, A commitment to making a difference in the world. A carefully prepared application demonstrating academic excellence and alignment with the scholarship goals is essential.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES) is a prestigious program provided by the Government of Ireland and managed by the Higher Education Authority (HEA). It is designed to support high-calibre international students who wish to pursue master’s, postgraduate diploma, or PhD level studies in Ireland. The scholarship aims to attract top-tier international students who demonstrate the potential to be future leaders in their fields and are committed to making a difference in the world, offering an academically enriching and financially feasible experience.
Application_Documents:
*   Academic transcripts
*   Recommendation letters (as detailed above)
*   Personal statements
*   A conditional or final offer of admission from an eligible Irish higher education institution.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The TIPP scholarship is a premier fully funded program designed to cover all major expenses for international students pursuing postgraduate studies in Thailand.
*   Full Tuition Fee
*   Accommodation Allowance (ranging from 7,000–9,000 Baht/month, depending on the study location)
*   Stipend / Monthly Living Allowances
*   Round Air Tickets
*   Research Funding
*   Other Allowances
Quantity: Postgraduate: Over 70 annually, Training Fellowships: Over 700 (as of 2020/2021)
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be citizens or residents of developing countries. A mandatory requirement is nomination by the National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation (such as the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in the applicant's home country) or by relevant central government agencies for which the nominated candidates currently work. Civil servants applying for this scholarship must meet all relevant criteria prescribed in their respective country's civil service regulations (e.g., BCSR 2023 for Bhutanese civil servants) in addition to the TIPP scholarship guidelines. Applicants from outside civil service (e.g., Corporate, Private Sector, NGOs) must fulfill all relevant criteria prescribed by their national Department of Workforce Planning and Skills Development (or equivalent body) in addition to the TIPP scholarship guidelines. Candidates must be in good physical and mental condition and must not be pregnant.
Eligible_Fields: Sufficiency Economy Philosophy, Public Health, Agricultural Sciences, Food Security, Climate Change, Environmental Science, Environmental Management, Bio-Circular-Green Economy, Sustainable Development
Eligible_Field_Group: SOCIAL SCIENCES & HUMANITIES, HEALTH & MEDICINE, STEM - NATURAL SCIENCES, INTERDISCIPLINARY & SPECIALIZED, BUSINESS & ECONOMICS
Special_Circumstances: Must be in good physical and mental condition, Must not be pregnant
Other_Requirements: Full-time study is a prerequisite, Mandatory nomination by National Focal Point or relevant central government agency
Scholarship_Info: The Thailand International Postgraduate Programme (TIPP) is a fully funded Master's and Ph.D. scholarship program established in 1999/2000 by the Royal Thai Government’s Thailand International Development Cooperation Agency (TICA), Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Its core mission is to expand Thailand’s commitment to fostering cooperation partnerships among developing countries, sharing Thailand’s best practices and experience, building global partnerships, empowering students with advanced skills and knowledge, and allowing participants to experience Thailand’s rich culture and warm hospitality.
Application_Documents:
The comprehensive application package typically includes:
*   The official TIPP application form (available online via the TICA website, with a hard copy submission requirement).
*   An English language certificate (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS).
*   At least 2-3 recommendation letters.
*   A thesis proposal or other documents as requested by the specific Thai university.
*   A Physical Examination form, to be completed by a physician.
*   Documentation of relevant qualification requirements and current work details.
Timeline:
2025-01-10 : Announcements for 2025 scholarships made by various national focal points and Royal Thai Embassy
2025-03-31 : Application Deadline for Fall 2026 intake
2025-2027 : Scholarships available for academic years

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs, Accommodation
Funding_Details:
The Italian Government Scholarship is a fully funded opportunity, designed to cover significant expenses for eligible students.

Key financial provisions include:
*   Tuition Fees: Full tuition waivers are provided, covering the cost of enrollment in Italian universities and institutions.
*   Monthly Living Allowance/Stipend: Scholars receive a monthly allowance of 900 Euros, disbursed on a quarterly basis. This translates to an estimated annual stipend ranging from €16,243 to €18,800.
*   Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance coverage is included, ensuring access to medical services during the scholarship period.

Regarding accommodation: There is conflicting information regarding housing expenses. While some sources indicate an additional housing allowance of €2,200 per year, others explicitly state that the scholarship does not cover accommodation expenses. It is important for applicants to verify the exact coverage for housing in the official call for applications for their specific academic year. Travel expenses are generally not covered by the scholarship.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be foreign students not residing in Italy or Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Candidates must hold an appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in their chosen Italian University or Institute. The scholarship is incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including DSU grants. Non-EU nationalities are eligible. Age Limits (by application deadline, except for renewals): Bachelor’s Degree: Not over 23 years old. Master’s Degree/AFAM/Italian Language and Culture Courses: Not over 28 years old (e.g., born after May 16, 1996, for the 2025-2026 call). PhD Programs: Not over 30 years old. Applicants for PhD programs must provide a letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University.
Eligible_Fields: Art History, Music, Theater Arts, Linguistics
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Language_Certificate: Official certifications; University language teacher certification (in some cases)
Age: Not over 23 for Bachelor’s; Not over 28 for Master’s/AFAM/Italian Language and Culture; Not over 30 for PhD
Special_Circumstances: Applicants must be foreign students not residing in Italy or Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). The scholarship is incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including DSU grants. Non-EU nationalities are eligible. Students on a scholarship are permitted to work part-time in Italy, subject to specific regulations and limits on working hours.
Other_Requirements: Applicants for PhD programs must provide a letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University. Selection is based on academic merit, motivation, and proficiency in Italian or English language. A dedicated selection committee, appointed by the Italian Embassy in each country, makes the final decision.
Scholarship_Info: The Italian Government Scholarship, officially known as the MAECI Grants, is a prestigious initiative offered by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI). Its primary goal is to promote cultural exchange, strengthen academic cooperation, and foster academic excellence by enabling international students and Italian citizens residing abroad (IRE) to pursue higher education in Italy. The scholarship provides a unique opportunity for students to immerse themselves in Italy's rich academic and cultural heritage.
Application_Documents:
Letter of acceptance (mandatory for PhD programs).
Certificate of Italian or English language proficiency.
Evidence of previous academic credentials (transcripts, diplomas).
Any other documents specified in the official call for applications.

Covered Expenses:

Applicants must apply for and be accepted into an eligible Master's degree program at a Flemish higher education institution. Proof of admission is mandatory to receive the scholarship, even if the admission decision is made after the scholarship selection. The previous degree (which the student has used to enroll for the Master's program) cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution. International students who have previously been enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution on credit mobility (such as Erasmus+) are still eligible for a Master Mind Scholarship. Scholarship_Info: The Master Mind Scholarship is a prestigious, fully-funded opportunity for outstanding international students worldwide to pursue an eligible Master's degree program in Flanders and Brussels, Belgium. It aims to attract top talent by covering tuition fees and providing a substantial living allowance.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Health Insurance, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Tuition fees (full coverage by the Higher Education Institutions)
Monthly Stipend: One million six hundred thousand (1,600,000) Colombian pesos, equivalent to three Colombian legal monthly minimum wages, to cover basic living expenses.
Health Insurance
Medical costs
Visa expenses
Travel Allowance
Book Allowance / Expenses for books and materials
Family Allowance
Rent
Installation expenses
Immigration support
One-time grant for the issuance of a foreign identification card
Eligibility_Criteria:
Nationality: Be a foreign citizen from any nationality. Dual Colombian nationality is not permitted.
Residency: Must not be residing in Colombia, nor have resided in Colombian territory for the last six (6) months prior to applying for the scholarship.
Prior Studies in Colombia: Must not have started studies in Colombia at the time of application.
Previous Beneficiary Status: Must not have been a beneficiary of this program (Beca Colombia) in previous calls or through ICETEX.
Academic Background: Must possess a professional or bachelor's degree to pursue graduate studies (Master's, Doctoral, or Specialization).
Age Limit: Not older than 50 years.
Language_Certificate: B2 level in Spanish language (written and spoken) or another certificate that endorses the level of the Spanish language.
Special_Circumstances:
Target Audience: The scholarship is specifically aimed at high-achieving international students demonstrating exceptional academic merit and leadership potential.
Post-Scholarship Obligation: Scholarship recipients agree not to request a visa to remain in Colombia for two (2) years from the date the scholarship ends. The purpose of Beca Colombia is to facilitate academic formation in Colombian institutions, after which the scholarship recipient must return to their country of origin or residence to apply the knowledge acquired.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must meet all academic, language, and documentation requirements specified in the call.
Scholarship_Info: The Beca Colombia Scholarship Programme for Foreigners is a fully funded initiative by the Government of Colombia, administered by ICETEX (Colombian Institute of Educational Credit and Technical Studies Abroad). Designed for high-achieving international students with exceptional academic merit and leadership potential, this program aims to foster academic, cultural, and technological exchange while strengthening social ties between international students and Colombian institutions. It offers foreign citizens the opportunity to pursue Master's, Doctoral, or Specialization degrees in public and private Colombian higher education institutions, covering a wide range of study fields. The scholarship is offered as part of Colombia's Reciprocity Programme, acknowledging international cooperation received by Colombia under Educational Exchange Agreements. Program Goal: To provide foreign citizens with an opportunity to strengthen their academic formation in Colombian institutions and apply acquired knowledge in their home countries.
Application_Documents:
Academic transcript (to prove GPA and academic history).
Experience report (signed by a tutor or academic program director, to verify work experience).
(Post-selection) Certification from a financial institution stating account number and foreign identification card number for stipend disbursement.

Funding_Details:
The Australian Government allocates funds to eligible Higher Education Providers (HEPs), which then administer the scholarships to support students pursuing Research Doctorate and Research Masters degrees. The RTP funding encompasses:
*   RTP Fees Offset: Covers 100% of tuition fees for the duration of the scholarship (e.g., up to 14 research periods at the University of Sydney).
*   RTP Stipends: Provided for living costs. The annual stipend rate varies; for 2025, the Australian Government’s base stipend rate is A$33,511 per annum (Curtin University), with Griffith University offering A$34,752.
*   RTP Allowances: Cover additional costs related to research training.
*   Overseas Student Health Care (OSHC) Policy: For international students, a single OSHC policy is usually provided. Dual-family or multi-family policies may be approved at university discretion.
*   Travel and Removal Allowances: Some universities (e.g., ANU) offer these.
*   Relocation Costs: Up to A$2,000 may be provided to assist with relocation (e.g., UniSC).
Quantity: Limited and competitive. Most universities typically award about 10% of their RTP scholarships to international students. For example, Flinders University offers a limited number (up to 6) of AGRTPS to international students each year.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be prospective or current Higher Degree by Research (HDR) students, enrolled in or commencing an accredited Research Doctorate or Research Masters degree at an eligible Australian HEP. Scholarships are for high-achieving international and domestic students with an outstanding academic record. Applicants must satisfy their chosen university's specific academic and English language entry requirements. Domestic students need a Commonwealth Higher Education Student Support Number (CHESSN). Applicants must have completed a degree with a substantial research component (at least 25%), such as an Honours degree or higher, or possess equivalent international qualifications. Students must not be receiving income from another source specifically for general living costs while holding an RTP Stipend Scholarship. Scholarship holders must accept and commence their program by the dates specified in their offer letter. Candidates are subject to all University policies and academic program requirements. For current HDR students, scholarships typically commence from January 1st, with enrollment no later than March of the following year. Part-time scholarship recipients are subject to the same employment restrictions as full-time students, unless otherwise approved.
Min_Gpa: Not explicitly stated, but outstanding academic achievement is required; anecdotal evidence suggests a perfect or near-perfect GPA is often necessary.
Experience_Years: Previous research experience is a crucial factor.
Language_Certificate: Mandatory for non-native English speakers, specific requirements set by chosen university.
Other_Requirements: Applicants are typically required to provide a written personal reference from a responsible person who is not a relative or a staff member of the university. Applicants must contact their chosen eligible Higher Education Provider (HEP) directly for application procedures. An initial step may involve obtaining an 'Invitation to Apply' from a registered supervisor and submitting an Expression of Interest (EOI) form. Applicants must clearly demonstrate their willingness and capacity to establish effective supervisory support for their research project.
Scholarship_Info: The Australia Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarships are a prestigious initiative provided by the Australian Government. These scholarships are designed to support both domestic and international students undertaking Higher Degree by Research (HDR) programs in Australia. The program aims to foster high-quality research training across eligible Australian Higher Education Providers (HEPs).
Application_Documents:
Curriculum Vitae (CV)
Proof of English language proficiency
Written personal reference
Expression of Interest (EOI) form (may be required)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
The scholarship primarily covers tuition fees, either fully or partially. Unlike some other scholarships, the BGS explicitly focuses on tuition, with no mention of accommodation, living expenses, or medical insurance being covered as standard benefits.

For full scholarship recipients, specific annual amounts are allocated based on the study level:
*   Bachelor's Degree: 20,000 RMB
*   Master's Degree: 30,000 RMB
*   Doctoral Degree: 40,000 RMB
*   Senior Scholars / Long-term Language Students: 10,000 RMB

Partial scholarships typically cover a portion of the tuition fee, such as half or a quarter of the tuition for one academic year.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be non-Chinese citizens. Must be in good health and willing to obey the laws and regulations of China. Applicants must be self-funded students at the time of application and must not be receiving other tuition scholarship funds from any other source. For international students already enrolled in a Beijing university and applying for the BGS, the average score of their previous academic year must be no less than 80/100. The applicant's previous degree should preferably be from a prestigious university or research institution in their home country. A minimum average score of at least 80/100 or a GPA of 3.0 is required for the previous degree.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree, PhD
Min_Gpa: For previous degree: 80/100 or GPA 3.0; For current students (previous academic year): 80/100
Language_Certificate: English-taught programs: IELTS 6.0 or TOEFL 75 or above (exemptions for applicants from countries where English is an official language). Chinese-taught undergraduate programs: HSK-4 level (score 222 or above). Chinese-taught postgraduate programs: HSK-5 level or above.
Scholarship_Info: The Beijing Government Scholarship (BGS) is a prestigious funding program established by the Beijing Municipal Government. Its primary objective is to attract and support outstanding international students and scholars to pursue academic studies or conduct scientific research at universities within the Beijing region. The scholarship aims to promote the development of higher education for international students in Beijing, fostering a dynamic and high-quality academic environment. The BGS offers both full and partial scholarships, primarily covering tuition fees, and is administered directly by participating universities in Beijing.
Application_Documents:
Completed Application Materials: All necessary documents as specified by the individual university's application system.
Statement of Purpose: A clear statement indicating the duration and purpose of study, preferred technical work or experience, and academic background.
Letters of Recommendation: Two letters of recommendation, typically from professors or associate professors, are required for graduate programs and senior scholar programs.

Scholarship_Name: National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The NSP is a fully funded program designed to cover the living costs associated with the scholarship stay.
*   Financial Coverage: The scholarship covers living costs during the stay in Slovakia.
*   Stipend Details: Monthly stipends vary based on the applicant's category and can range from €620 to €1470. Some sources indicate stipends up to €1025 or €1470 per month. For Master's and PhD students, an annual stipend of €14,400 has been mentioned.
*   Travel Allowance: International students and PhD students are eligible for a travel allowance to cover costs related to their study or research stays in Slovakia. For Slovak scholarship holders undertaking stays abroad, travel allowances are provided for all eligible categories.
*   Application Fee: There is no application fee required for the Slovak Republic NSP Scholarship, making it accessible to all eligible international students.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be international nationals (excluding citizens of Slovakia) who are currently studying or working outside Slovakia. The program supports Master’s students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers, and artists. Applicants must be from an eligible country. International student applicants should generally not have studied in Slovakia previously. A crucial requirement is acceptance by a Slovak host institution (a public, private, or state university, or a research institution eligible to carry out a doctoral study program, such as the Slovak Academy of Sciences) for the intended mobility stay. Applicants must be admitted or invited to a local university for the duration of their scholarship. The program also supports Slovak university students, PhD students, and postdocs from Slovak universities or research organizations for study or research stays at institutions outside Slovakia.
Min_Gpa: 3.0 (reportedly, from Facebook group, may not be universally official across all program iterations or categories)
Experience_Years: 2 years (for university teachers, researchers, artists; PhD studies count as relevant work experience)
Language_Certificate: Applications and all required attachments must be submitted in Slovak or English. Official translations into Slovak or English are mandatory for documents originally in other languages. For specific scholarships (e.g., for a Tanzanian student), studies must be conducted entirely in the Slovak language.
Age: 18-26 (for Bachelor's and Master's degree candidates), 23-35 (for PhD degree candidates)
Special_Circumstances: In exceptional circumstances (force majeure), unofficial translations may be initially accepted, but official translations will be required before the final letter of award. Specific subject areas may vary by applicant's country of origin. International student applicants should generally not have studied in Slovakia previously. The scholarship may support Bachelor's leading to Master's degree studies in specific cases (e.g., for a Tanzanian student).
Other_Requirements: Applicants must be accepted by a Slovak host institution for their mobility stay and must be admitted or invited to a local university for the duration of the scholarship. The NSP is primarily for short-term academic, research, teaching, or artistic mobility stays and is not a full-time scholarship for complete Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree programs.
Scholarship_Info: The National Scholarship Programme (NSP) of the Slovak Republic is a prestigious, fully funded mobility program established in 2005 by the Government of the Slovak Republic. Administered by the Ministry of Education, Research, Development, and Youth, its primary objective is to foster international academic, research, teaching, and artistic exchange. The NSP supports short-term stays for international Master's students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers, and artists at Slovak higher education and research institutions. Additionally, it facilitates mobility for Slovak university students, PhD students, and postdocs undertaking stays abroad.
Application_Documents: While a specific comprehensive list of required application materials is not provided, applicants are expected to gather and submit necessary documents, including an enrollment application for the country stay program. All attachments must be in Slovak or English. For documents originally in other languages, official translations into Slovak or English are mandatory. In extraordinary circumstances (force majeure) preventing official translations, unofficial translations made by the applicant may be temporarily accepted, but official translations corresponding to the unofficial ones will be mandatory before the official letter of award is issued.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The KNB Scholarship is a fully funded program, covering all essential expenses for the duration of the study.

Covered Expenses include:
* Tuition fees
* Living allowance
* Health insurance
* Airfare (return ticket)
* Research costs
* Book allowance

Stipend and Allowances:
Awardees receive a monthly living allowance, which includes an amount of IDR 1,500,000. Additionally, during both the Bahasa Indonesia Language Program (BIPA) and the subsequent academic program, KNB students will receive monthly research and book allowances upon their arrival in Indonesia.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Applicants must be citizens of a developing country. A crucial requirement is a recommendation letter from the Indonesian Representative (Embassy or Consulate General) in the applicant's home country; applicants cannot register without this letter. The Indonesian Representative is responsible for collecting and reviewing all required documents, including educational background, work history, and document validity, before issuing the recommendation.

For Master's applicants, a Bachelor's degree is required. Master's degree holders are generally not eligible to apply for a Bachelor's scholarship. For Doctoral applicants, a Master's degree is required.

Preferably, applicants should have at least 2 years of work experience, which can include experience as a government employee or a Professional Experience Certificate from an organization.

While English proficiency is required, knowledge of Bahasa Indonesia is not a prerequisite, as a 1-year language program (BIPA) is provided.

Recommendation letters are required from the employer/immediate supervisor (if working), previous schools (academic), and for Doctoral applicants, from a potential research supervisor at a KNB Scholarship partner university.

Applicants must intend to study full-time. There is no application fee for the KNB Scholarship.
Min_Gpa: Bachelor's applicants: 3.0/4.0 or 3.5/4.0 (undergraduate programs); Master's/Doctoral applicants: 2.30/3.00 or 3.7/4.0 (graduate studies). Verification with university/official guidelines recommended.
Language_Certificate: English or Japanese proficiency required. Accepted tests: TOEFL ITP (min 500), TOEFL IBT (min 61), IELTS (min 6.0), TOEIC (min 575), JLPT. Certificates must be valid within 2 years.
Age: Bachelor's: Max 35 years old; Master's/Doctoral: Max 40 years old
Other_Requirements: Applicants must be citizens of a developing country. Must intend to study full-time. No application fee.
Scholarship_Info: The Kemitraan Negara Berkembang (KNB) Scholarship is a prestigious, fully funded program offered by the Government of Indonesia for international students from developing countries. It supports Bachelor's, Master's, or Doctoral degrees at top Indonesian universities. The program is a key part of Indonesia’s global cooperation and South–South Partnership initiatives, aiming to strengthen educational diplomacy and foster international collaboration through world-class education and a unique cultural experience.
Application_Documents:
* Final Diploma / Scanned Degree Certificate (for previous degree)
* Academic Transcripts (scanned, in English)
* Recommendation Letter from the Indonesian Representative in the applicant's country
* Recommendation Letter from employer/immediate supervisor (if working)
* Academic Recommendation Letters from previous schools
* Recommendation letter from a potential research supervisor (for doctoral applicants)
* Proof of English/Japanese proficiency (TOEFL, IELTS, JLPT, etc.)
* Work history (if any)
* Any other relevant certificates
